data.title: PS3 - PS2 game covers not showing up on Webman
data.meta_description: So i'm having this really annoying issue with webMan, the game covers just wont show up, i just get an infinite loading icon, some do show up at...
data.text:
@Falco1211 : finally did you managed to fix the issue , im experiencing that too

@Berion

@aldostools : I try to install Berion covers but im experiencing the same issue than Falso1211.

First I need to start that I was able to erase/re-install all my PS2 ISO (not splitted anymore , single piece ISOs) via FTP

but as soon i installed webman 1.47.37 (i dont even know if its linked to giving/installing PS2 cover automatically or if its mmcm that do this part ?!) but quickly i had PS2 covers installed automatically.

I wanted to erase them from to start from ground zeroes and installing Berion ones (more definition in covers and custom ones too that please me a lots)

QUESTION 1 : but when i go to dev_hddo / PS2ISO / the automatically installed ones DONT APPEAR there...

so im wondering whats the path to see / erase them. ?

QUESTION 2 : I installed approx +/- 30 PS2 cover arts made by Berion that i CAREFULLY renamed the covers with the EXACT game titles.

Exemple :

FATAL FRAME I [SLES_508.21].iso

FATAL FRAME I [SLES_508.21].png

....but even after a restart console , webman refresh XML & XMB , refresh XML , refresh HTML

the damn cover dont show up ???

it super mysterious since somes (of the +/- 30 covers installed) show up and somes dont !

Compared to another Game that correctly matched on webman the game & cover :

GENJI Dawn of the samurai [SCES_533.28].iso

GENJI Dawn of the samurai [SCES_533.28].iso

This one show the cover flawlessly on the webman my game PLAYSTATIONr2 Folder.

Initally i thought OK since Pinky mention 194x194 maybe i have cover in different resolution , but i checked them all in my usb folder and they are ALL 268x268 32 color !?!?!

The only difference i can see is that FATAL FRAME I png = 106 ko vs GENJI png = 112 ko

Recently I remember that after having erased my PS2 (splitted /mess) ISOs a friend of mine told me it should be a good iday to "rebuild data base" if i remember correctly , maybe it changed my webman memory size selection. wich i honestly dont remember what i have choose years ago...

Berion explained to me :

"Try to increase memory size from default to larger. To be honest, I never test this extensively (I have put few covers, they worked so I didn't bother to test it more; high probably You are first who use WMM set ). I've used larger size possible (268x268 px) because in SMAN and some of cover views in multiMAN/IRISMAN, they looks best natively, instead of scaled from smaller to larger. For XMB alone 128x128 is the best choice if I'm correct. Maybe some covers isn't show because there is not enough left free space for LV2? Try to ask aldostools or search forum. I believe I saw some similar issue few years ago also with covers (but not mine)."

Did i have to change the option here ? (Highlighted in red circle on the picture)

wish one i should select between :

Standard (896KB)

Min (320KB)

Min+(512KB)

max (1280kb)

max PS3+ (1088K PS3)

max PSX+ (368K PS3 + 768K PSX)

max BLU+ (368K PS3 + 768K BLU)

max PSP+ (368K PS3 + 768K PSP)

max PS2+ (368K PS3 + 768K PS2)

?

...and right aside this select option i see desactive (desactivated)

should i left this alone untouched or i should select something between :

4 - bg

3 - fg

2 - debug

1 - app

?

My setup :

PS3 CECH-2001a CFW Cobra Rebug CEX 4.86

HDD available free space : 424.14 GB / 931 GB (1TB)

Webman MOD 1.47.37

100 PSX ISOs on a USB stick including various roms/iso/bin-cue 110 Gb on 115 (4.92 Gb left for Irisman config/saves/screen)

100 PS2 ISOs ( 317 Gb) on dev hdd0

100 PS3 ISOs on external HDD Fat32

Normally I left my USB stick plugged and i only plug the PS3 ISOs HDD to install the game utilitaire (dont know the name in english) to play the game then erase it quickly after to not stock pile them unnecessarily.

So what you would suggest Aldostools ?

Attached Files:

IMG_8521.JPG

File size:

2.1 MB

Views:

56

IMG_8522.JPG

File size:

3 MB

Views:

55

Hi Dear friend.

I selected maximum option for the memory and refresh everyting = no result at all

I downloaded your XnviewMP but ohhh my god i dont understand the program , sooo many option!

I tried 3x time to resize a single cover art i choose 194x194 and in the end it start at 268x268.... i dont know what im doing and how to proceed correctly...

I will make something with you

when you will have more time on your side Monday , could you send me this cover arts resized 2x time

1x 128x128

1x 194x194

1x 268x268 a 2th time , maybe you changed something in the process the 1st i have

I will try them all individually in my mmcm and will give you the result.

Sound like a plan ?

I wish you a very nice week

waiting for your next update

EDIT : oh I think i got something 194x194 , I will do the 128x128 and test them immediatelly

Attached Files:

Fatal Frame (SLUS-20388).png

File size:

105.2 KB

Views:

29

I managed to be able to have 268x268 (like yours others) + 194x194 & 128x128 images

I tested them all one by one individually before erasing and copy/paste the others one by one like this :

FATAL FRAME I [SLES_508.21].iso

FATAL FRAME I [SLES_508.21].png

Guess what ?

NO COVER appear....?!

I start thinking that the name of the iso must have the right region title

in this case i name the game with the NTSC format while the game is PAL (for my french dubbing purpose while i live in North America) or that i should NOT include a number BEFORE or AFTER the game title like for exemple : 007 NIGHTFIRE or MANHUNT 2 .... but no , it change strictly nothing because somes of your 268x268 cover arts you made APPEAR.

WHY somes DONT left me scratching my head hard....

@aldostools , please ....did you know why ?

Try this approach to figure out "who or what is the problem":

- Take an ISO that is shown, make a copy of iso and its png

- Rename copied files as iso and PNG not showed (FATAL FRAME ..bla bla bla... for example)

Put fake ISO and PNG where they should be putted and restart PS3

Fake game is showed?

An alternative is to just change the png not shown to one shown, with the name changed according to the ISO.

@aldostools @Crystal , @Algol : Nope the approach didnt changed anything

I copied a game that is show : Metal Slug Anthology in this case + its associated .png image and renamed them :

FATAL FRAME I [SLES_508.21].iso

FATAL FRAME I [SLES_508.21].png

And copied it in the PS2ISO folder

I turned the console off

I turned it on

using webman I made a XML & XMB / XML / HTML Refresh

Guess what ... ? the Newly Fatal Frame I (Metal Slug Anthology) completely ERASED my original genuine Fatal Frame I off the HDD0 to REPLACE IT with the fake one and NO Fatal Frame I.png show.

EDIT : Like i explained at the start , all my image are in .png format , same resolution

SOMES appear/show OTHERS simply dont want to show ?!?

ALSO For the one that Berion DIDNT make , the console created SOMES of them (approximatelly 15% of my 100 PS2 ISO installed) in the console ?

what is the path for me to find them please...because they dont show in the mmcm HDDO PS2ISO folder..... so where they are ? the path...?

I dont understand

I truly need help here please (anyone with even a little clue who are able to explain what happen with this problem is welcome

Try different test.

Rename i.e "PS2ISO" to i.e "PS2_old" (name doesn't matter ;]).

Create PS2ISO folder.

Copy game for which cover isn't displayed from "old" to "new empty one"; do the same with cover itself.

Restart (full cycle) console.

If cover will be displayed, it means that there is some problem with WMM and I cannot help You.

If cover will be not displayed, add another game and its cover but the one which was displayed before and again, restart console. If new one will appear and old will stay not read, it means that problem lies in PNG format (just like JPEG, it is quite complicated format and libpng used by PSP/PS3 are piece of shit ;]). This means I need to prepare some variations to test for You. It is possible anyway, that my gfx have some flaws because I removed every metadata and maximally compressed them to be as simple as possible, and ass much as possible small.

Ok Berion , thanks I will make this new test right now and get back with result
